definition: to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse

sentences.english: Google's natural impulse is to unleash its algorithms on this video content in order to search it.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌的本能是在影片内容上挥洒其演算法以利搜寻。

sentences.english: Dryad : Flyer, No Enemy Retaliation, Spray Attack, Treant Union.
sentences.chinese: 飞行兵种，无反击，挥洒攻击，树精联盟。

sentences.english: This is so that the viewer can fill in the rest with his or her imagination.
sentences.chinese: 这是为了让观众可以在空白处尽情挥洒想象力。

sentences.english: You’re truly a social butterfly and love to scatter your energy everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 你的确是个社交花蝴蝶，喜欢到处挥洒自己的活力。

sentences.english: The BBC Symphony Orchestra played with great panache .
sentences.chinese: 英国广播公司交响乐团演奏起来挥洒自如。

sentences.english: I bent, held some water, threw to a distance.
sentences.chinese: 我弯下身，掬起一捧海水，向远方挥洒。

sentences.english: How they dance in the parterre sweet summer sweat.
sentences.chinese: 在花坛中他们舞的多欢，挥洒着夏日甜味的香汗。

sentences.english: Literally meaning two hander's, in German, in reference to the grip needed to wield their massive swords.
sentences.chinese: 双手巨剑需要紧密掌握方可挥洒如意。

sentences.english: He swims easily in the stream of his own temperament.
sentences.chinese: 他将自己的气质秉性挥洒自如，如行云流水。

sentences.english: The hot sun, we sprinkle with sweat, has no doubts whatsoever.
sentences.chinese: 炎炎烈日下，我们挥洒着汗水，却无怨无悔。

sentences.english: Taiping Street fabulously displays Changsha's thousand-year-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 一条太平街，将长沙千年来的文化尽情挥洒。

sentences.english: Enforcement of such scholars take hold a brush, stippling sway, they dress.
sentences.chinese: 文人执之如搦毛笔，点画挥洒，气定神闲。

sentences.english: He lifted the brush pen, and wrote three words smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 他举起笔来挥洒自如的写了三个字。

sentences.english: Sprinkle in good conversation and witty repartee and you are on to something special.
sentences.chinese: 在谈吐中灵敏机智，挥洒自如让你做到特别。

definition: to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
to criss-cross/to run unhindered across the whole country
